Stephen King: Amateurs sit and wait for inspiration, the rest of us just get up and go to work.
Bruce Lee: If you spend too much time thinking about a thing, you'll never get it done.
Brian Tracy: ...you cannot eat every tadpole and frog in the pond, but you can eat the biggest and ugliest one, and that will be enough, at least for the time being.
Olin Miller: If you want to make an easy job seem mighty hard, just keep putting off doing it.
Karen Lamb: A year from now you may wish you had started today.
You don’t have to see the whole staircase, just take the first step.
Dale Carnegie: Do the hard jobs first. The easy jobs will take care of themselves.
Eva Young: To think too long about doing a thing often becomes its undoing.
David Allen: Much of the stress that people feel doesn’t come from having too much to do. It comes from not finishing what they started.
